channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Efficient Eigenstate Preparation in an Integrable Model with Hilbert Space Fragmentation
item.description: arXiv:2411.15132v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We consider the preparation of all the eigenstates of spin chains using quantum circuits. It is known that generic eigenstates of free-fermionic spin chains can be prepared with circuits whose depth grows only polynomially with the length of the chain and the number of particles. We show that the polynomial growth is also achievable for selected interacting models where the interaction between the particles is sufficiently simple. Our working example is the folded XXZ model, an integrable spin chain that exhibits Hilbert space fragmentation. We present the explicit quantum circuits that prepare arbitrary eigenstates of this model on an open chain efficiently. We perform error-mitigated noisy simulations with circuits of up to 13 qubits and different connectivities between qubits, achieving a relative error below 5%. As a byproduct, we extend a recent reformulation of the Bethe ansatz as a quantum circuit from closed to open boundary conditions.
item.dc:creator: Roberto Ruiz, Alejandro Sopena, Bal\'azs Pozsgay, Esperanza L\'opez

item.title: Geometry of Integrable Systems Related to the Restricted Grassmannian
item.description: arXiv:2407.21605v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A hierarchy of differential equations on a Banach Lie-Poisson space related to the restricted Grassmannian is studied. Flows on the groupoid of partial isometries and on the restricted Grassmannian are described, and a momentum map picture is presented.
item.dc:creator: Tomasz Goli\'nski, Alice Barbara Tumpach

item.title: Fluid dynamics duality and solution of decaying turbulence
item.description: arXiv:2411.01389v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We describe the duality of incompressible Navier-Stokes fluid dynamics in three dimensions, leading to its reformulation in terms of a one-dimensional momentum loop equation. \textbf{The momentum loop equation does not have finite-time blow-up solutions.} The decaying turbulence is a solution of this equation equivalent to a string theory with discrete target space made of regular star polygons and Ising degrees of freedom on the sides. This string theory is solvable in the turbulent limit, equivalent to the quasiclassical approximation in a nontrivial calculable background. \textbf{As a result, the spectrum of decay indexes is analytically computed, and it agrees very well with real and numerical experiments. } Among the decay indexes, there are complex conjugate pairs related to zeros of the Riemann zeta function. The Kolmogorov scaling laws are replaced by certain number theory functions, which are nonlinear in the log-log scale.
item.dc:creator: Alexander Migdal
